channel.title: Allowing connection from other clients
channel.description: I'm using PI, and if you log in from somthing like silab, it kicks you right away. How can I remove this? As I have alot of players who try to connect via silab. I know they will be a lil buggy becuase they dont have my client, but its better then nothing. Thanks!

item.title: Allowing connection from other clients
item.dc:creator: @TheEndGame TheEndGame
item.description:
@TheEndGame wrote:

Sadly unite cant find that in my client.java. Im working with a packaged server,

Read full topic

item.title: Allowing connection from other clients
item.dc:creator: @runeite51 runeite51
item.description:
@runeite51 wrote:

Easy.

  1. Server sided:
    a. Open client.java
    b. Search for: int expectedUid =
    c. Change whatever number is there to 1.
    d. Compile.
  2. Client sided:
    a. Open client.java
    b. Search for: int ai[] = new int[4]
    c. Then under aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method402(ai[3]);, you should see
    aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method402(#) (change the # (will be a different number in your client) to 1.)
    d. Compile.

Read full topic

item.title: Allowing connection from other clients
item.dc:creator: @TheEndGame TheEndGame
item.description:
@TheEndGame wrote:

They wouldn’t be able to see items and vengeance would probably kick them. I am pretty sure there is something in my server that is kicking them. It wouldn’t be instant otherwise.

Read full topic
